sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"普通的，普遍的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: common, ordinary, commonplace, general, usual, popular, universal
means: common ： 多用于指物，侧重很常见，不稀奇。
ordinary ： 用于物，指每天发生，十分平淡无奇；用于人，指无特别之处，很一般。
general ： 语气强于common，侧重大多如此，很少有例外情况。
usual ： 指常见常闻和常做的事或举动，强调惯常性。
popular ： 指适应大众爱好、需要，为大家所公认或接受。
universal与general同义，但语气较强，侧重对每个人或事物都适用，根本没有例外。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"共同的，相互的"之意。
means: mutual ： 着重彼此共有或共享，局限于双方的关系。
common ： 侧重两人或多人共有共同，但不暗示彼此间存在的等价关系。
joint ： 强调至少两人或两方共同占用，侧重指一个统一体。
reciprocal ： 着重互惠，有来有往。

sentence.Network_en: His destination was Chobham Common, a long way from his Cotswold home.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的目的地是乔伯姆公地，那里和他在科茨沃尔德的家离得很远。

sentence.Network_en: Eczema is a common skin complaint which often runs in families.
sentence.Network_cn: 湿疹是一种常见的皮肤病，通常具遗传性。

sentence.Network_en: Canadian libel law is based on English common law.
sentence.Network_cn: 加拿大的诽谤法是以英国的习惯法为基础的。

PerfectNetExp.abs: common dog behavioral problems and what might be causing them ., 常见的狗的行为问题和可能造成他们.
字典中恒字的解释 ... (2) 同本义[ lasting;permanent] (4) 寻常;普通[ constant;common] (1) 经常,常常[ always].
... . . .又如:公气(正大,公正);公素(公正质朴);公洁(公正廉洁);公慎(公正谨慎);公诚(公正诚实)共,共同common天下有公利而莫或兴之,有公害而莫或除之清·黄宗羲原君.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... at present 现在； 目前 common adj 共同的；普遍的 set free 释放.

jx.jx_en_mean: the benefit or interests of all

lj.lj_ly: it is time our elected officials stood up for the common good.
lj.lj_ls: 该是我们选出的公务员们维护公益的时候了。

jx.jx_en_mean: a point accepted or shared by each of two or more conflicting or differing parties
jx.jx_cn_mean: （冲突矛盾双方或多方承认的）共同立论基础

lj.lj_ly: artists from different cultural backgrounds found common ground.
lj.lj_ls: 有着不同文化背景的艺术家们找到了共同基础。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 大多数人都知道的事，众所周知之事；常识

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)of the usual or ordinary type
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)平常的，普通的，平凡的

lj.lj_ly: Britain's common or garden house sparrow.

jx.jx_en_mean: a thing or things held jointly
the ability to get on with or appeal to ordinary people
jx.jx_cn_mean: 平易近人的能力；与普通人相处（或打动普通人）的能力

jx.jx_en_mean: have a specified amount or degree of shared interests or characteristics
jx.jx_cn_mean: 有共同之处（或兴趣、特征）

lj.lj_ly: the two men had little in common.
lj.lj_ls: 这两个人没什么共同之处。

lj.lj_ly: in common with other officers I had to undertake guard duties.
lj.lj_ls: 和其他军官一样，我不得不承担警戒任务。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 一样，同样：与所有的都相同地

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French comun (adjective), from Latin communis

encyclopedia.content: Common 是Hip-Hop音乐界的一个标志性的人物，是史上最有天分的说唱(Rap)艺人和作词家，被称为说唱界的Bob Dylan。Common有文化的歌词和流畅的爵士说唱风格，使他成为美国说唱界少有的几个有影响力并“有教养”的说唱歌手之一。 同时作为单词，Common泛指“普遍的，常见的”的意思。

entry.def: If something is common, it is found in large numbers or it happens often.

example.ex: His name was Hansen, a common name in Norway...
example.tran: 他的名字叫汉森，在挪威是一个常见的名字。

example.ex: Oil pollution is the commonest cause of death for seabirds...
example.tran: 石油污染是造成海鸟死亡最常见的原因。

entry.def: If something is common to two or more people or groups, it is done, possessed, or used by  them all.

example.ex: Moldavians and Romanians share a common language...
example.tran: 摩尔达维亚人和罗马尼亚人使用同一种语言。

example.ex: Such behaviour is common to all young people.
example.tran: 这种行为在年轻人中司空见惯。

entry.def: When there are more animals or plants of a particular species than there are of related species, then the first species is called common .
Common is used to indicate that someone or something is of the ordinary kind and not special in any way.

example.ex: Democracy might elevate the common man to a position of political superiority...
example.tran: 民主也许能提升普通人的政治地位，让他们产生优越感。

example.ex: Common salt is made up of 40% sodium and 60% chloride.
example.tran: 食盐由40%的钠和60%的氯化物构成。

entry.def: Common decency or common courtesy is the decency or courtesy which most people have. You usually talk about this when someone has not shown these characteristics in their behaviour to show your disapproval of them.

example.ex: It is common decency to give your seat to anyone in greater need...
example.tran: 给更有需要的人让座是最起码的礼貌。

example.ex: He didn't have the common courtesy to ask permission.
example.tran: 他连邀准这种最起码的礼貌都没有。

entry.tran: (知识等)众所周知的，共有的，共识的
entry.def: You can use common to describe knowledge, an opinion, or a feeling that is shared by people in general.

example.ex: It is common knowledge that swimming is one of the best forms of exercise.
example.tran: 大家都知道游泳是最好的锻炼方式之一。

example.ex: ...the common view that acupuncture is only a fringe area of medicine.
example.tran: 针灸仅仅是医学的一个边缘领域的这种普遍看法

entry.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as common, you mean that they show a lack of taste, education, and good manners.

example.ex: She might be a little common at times, but she was certainly not boring.
example.tran: 她有时候可能有点粗俗，但绝对不会让人生厌。

entry.tran: (通常指村庄、小镇或其附近的)公共草地
entry.def: A common is an area of grassy land, usually in or near a village or small town, where the public is allowed to go.

example.ex: We are warning women not to go out on to the common alone.
example.tran: 我们告诫女性不要独自去公共草地。

entry.tran: 同 the House of Commons;(亦指)下议员议员们
entry.def: The Commons is the same as the House of Commons. The members of the House of Commons can also be referred to as the Commons .

example.ex: The Prime Minister is to make a statement in the Commons this afternoon...
example.tran: 今天下午首相将在下议院发表声明。

example.ex: The Commons has spent over three months on the bill.
example.tran: 下议院在这项议案上已经花了3个多月的时间。

entry.def: If two or more things have something in common, they have the same characteristic or feature.

example.ex: The oboe and the clarinet have got certain features in common...
example.tran: 双簧管和单簧管有些相似之处。

example.ex: In common with most Italian lakes, access to the shores of Orta is restricted.
example.tran: 和大部分意大利湖泊一样，奥尔塔湖岸不对公众开放。

entry.def: If two or more people have something in common, they share the same interests or experiences.

example.ex: He had very little in common with his sister.
example.tran: 他和姐姐几乎没有什么共同语言。

means.word_mean: 1. a piece of open land for recreational use in an urban area;

sentences.sentence: "they went for a walk in the park"

means.word_mean: 1. belonging to or participated in by a community as a whole; public;

sentences.sentence: "common lands are set aside for use by all members of a community"

means.word_mean: 2. of no special distinction or quality; widely known or commonly encountered; average or ordinary or usual;

sentences.sentence: "it is common knowledge that she lives alone"

means.word_mean: 3. common to or shared by two or more parties;

sentences.sentence: "the mutual interests of management and labor"

means.word_mean: 5. being or characteristic of or appropriate to everyday language;

sentences.sentence: "the technical and vulgar names for an animal species"

means.word_mean: 6. of or associated with the great masses of people;

sentences.sentence: "the common people in those days suffered greatly"

means.word_mean: 7. of low or inferior quality or value;

sentences.sentence: "of what coarse metal ye are molded"- Shakespeare
"produced...the common cloths used by the poorer population"

means.word_mean: 8. lacking refinement or cultivation or taste;

sentences.sentence: "he had coarse manners but a first-rate mind"
"appealing to the vulgar taste for violence"
"the vulgar display of the newly rich"

auth_sentence.content: Woodwind instruments are common to virtually all musical cultures.
auth_sentence.res_content: Woodwind instruments are common to virtually all musical cultures.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Woodwind instruments are common to virtually all musical cultures.

auth_sentence.content: Leukaemia is the most common cancer diagnosed in children.
auth_sentence.res_content: Leukaemia is the most common cancer diagnosed in children.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Leukaemia is the most common cancer diagnosed in children.

auth_sentence.content: The most common scent made by plants is lemon.
auth_sentence.res_content: The most common scent made by plants is lemon.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The most common scent made by plants is lemon.

stems_affixes.type_exp: = 表示"服务,职责,社区,公共"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普通的,寻常的;共有的,公共的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mon=mun公共→共有的,公共的
com共同+mun社区+e→共同的社区→公社,引申为交流
im不+mun公共+ity表名词→不公共→不和别人一样[得病]→免疫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 交换思想,意见或感受,交流
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mun社区+e→共同的社区→公社,引申为交流
im不+mun公共+ize表动词→使不公共→使不和别人一样[得病]→使免疫

Sentence.sentence: Television repairman was a common occupation in the 1950s, for instance.
Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet, researchers are now warning against another common mealtime pitfall (陷阱) — salt.
Mary and she have a lot in common.

Family-friendly policies are its norm-with 16months of paid parental leave,special protections for part-time workers,and state-subsidized preschools where,according to a government website,"gender-awareness education is increasingly common.
Monarch butterflies, the large origin black insects, are common summer sights in northern United States and Canada.
The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice overtime

sentences.en: This sort of weather is quite common.

means.word_mean: 公有的, 共有的, 共同的

sentences.en: Britain and America share a common language.
sentences.cn: 英国和美国共用一种语言。

sentences.en: Certain desires are common to all men.
sentences.cn: 某些欲望对所有的人是共有的。

sentences.en: It is common knowledge that the earth is round.

jushi.english: Grass is a very common plant.
jushi.chinese: 草是一种很普通的植物。

jushi.english: This is in the common interest of the Third World.
jushi.chinese: 这是第三世界的共同利益。
